A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Not unfun\, and with some honestly extremely beautifully shot scenes\, The last jedi falls on its face with its  average writing.
The main subplot (or is it main plot?) is bloated and adds up to nothing other than some interesting but entirely unnecessary characters and conflicts. Of the newly introduced characters only one is mildly successful or interesting.

There is no disruption here\, as safe\, rushed and boring as episode 7 was\, it set up a much larger universe that is entirely abandoned in order to return to the big sellable good vs evil skit. 

If anything\, the last jedi manages to push the series forward as a more manageable marketable product.
